page.title: 13HOUSING IN KINGS LANGLEY
page.content: There is intensive housing on either side of the High Street (A41).Private housing predominates on western side. At the northern and southern ends are tree _ lined Council estates. Advent of by_pass on high ground further west coupled with Council policy to increase housing density in Kings Langley may, it is feared, lead to peripheral development changing the character of village. On eastern side housing is mixed. Denser developments are becoming a feature of the valley, west of canal. Pressures generated by construction of the M25 may lead to erosion of the Green Belt around village. Some urbanisation is inevitable. The fear is of further industrialization in the valley.
